definition: lit. lips and teeth (idiom); fig. close partners/interdependent
lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
labiodental (e.g. the consonant f in standard Chinese)

sentences.english: That humble Aiwowo, yet brings lasting relish on lips and teeth after eating.
sentences.chinese: 那不起眼的艾窝窝，吃完后简直是唇齿留香。

sentences.english: Any man's death diminishes me because I am involved in mankind.
sentences.chinese: 任何人的死都令我萎缩，因为我和全人类唇齿相依。

sentences.english: In such an interdependent world, what happens in Europe and the US will have an impact in Asia, probably sooner rather than later.
sentences.chinese: 在这唇齿相依的世界，欧美的现状早晚会影响亚洲。

sentences.english: The relationship between language and culture is intertwined.
And from your lips she drew the Hallelujah.
sentences.chinese: 她让你在唇齿之间再次哈利路亚。

sentences.english: The interests of Hong Kong and the Motherland are intricately linked and intertwined.
sentences.chinese: 香港与祖国一脉相连，唇齿相依。

sentences.english: The supportive relationship between lips and teeth; (fig) to be in a close, interdependent relationship.
sentences.chinese: 唇齿相依是对我们关系的最好形容。

sentences.english: Creativity and well being are intricately interrelated.
sentences.chinese: 创造力和福祉是唇齿相依的。

sentences.english: Taste portion abuse has thought, may still remain in between the lips and teeth.
sentences.chinese: 那份滋味儿至今想起，仍觉留于唇齿之间。

sentences.english: To fully appreciate its delicate fragrance and its aromas lingered in your mouth.
sentences.chinese: 以充分领略其清香馥郁，唇齿留香的感觉。

definition: mouth and teeth/enunciation/to articulate/diction/age (of cattle, horses etc)
dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
eloquence that generates perfume (idiom); profound and significant text
